embeds.title: Soul of Chaos
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

The fourth Ghostflame becomes a Mayhem Ghostflame.
Mayhem Ghostflame activates when you end your turn on it.
Ignition: Play the top card of your draw pile.
*Mayhem, made manifest.*

messages.content: this relic is awful
would you go as far to say its better to not have this relic than have it?
yes
it's worse than nothing
how could it be reworked while keeping its themeing?
my idea is: the first time you light a ghostflame each turn, play the top card of your draw pile
on a character who really really really cares about momentum, deliberate plays, card order, and positional + temporal thinking
this is worse than nothing
I would rather remove the mayhem flame and add another ghostflame type for bad omen, and add another rare relic
if  you want to be extra funny remove the first time limit
this is runic dodecahedron tier
NO

this isn't runic dodecahedron tier
because runic dodecahedron is not worse than nothing
insanely low bar, but still
would this be decent?
no because hexaghost is about deliberate plays it would only be good in afterlife decks
what about "the first time you ignite a ghostflame each turn, ignite it again"?
boring
like <six brand> boring

embeds.title: Six-Point Brand
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you play 6 cards, deal 6 damage to a random enemy.
*Fire, fire, fire, fire, fire, FIRE!*

messages.content: give your rare relics some spice
Play an attack, power, and skill on the same turn. Effect: Remove all debuffs, gain 1 intensity, plus 1 for each debuff removed.
That’s just <orange pellets> with a bit of spice

embeds.title: Orange Pellets
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / All / Slay the Spire

Whenever you play a Power, Attack, and Skill in the same turn, remove all of your debuffs.
*"Made from various fungi found throughout the Spire, they will stave off any affliction."*

messages.content: and the current version is mayhem with no spice and antisynergistic with what the character wants to do
You can spice the mayhem flame with stuff like catch up
this would replace the 2nd searing too btw
yeah and that never happens not to mention the existence of cards like <fast forward> <float> <advancing guard> <forked flame> ruining your other ghostflames

embeds.title: Fast Forward
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Draw 2 (3) cards.
**Advance.**

embeds.title: Float
embeds.description:
Basic Skill / 0 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Draw a card.
 (You may choose to)
hexamod: (Retract or **)Advance.**

embeds.title: Advancing Guard
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Gain 8 (11) **Block** :p_block:.
**Advance.**

embeds.title: Forked Flame
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 1 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Deal 5 (8) damage.
**Ignite** the previous, then the next Ghostflames.

messages.content: you need a deck premade for soul of chaos for it to work
a deck that looks opposite a typical hexaghost deck

Idk, if you have a deck that has a lot of advance/retract, this is a gf slot you can end your turn on and ignite with, with 0 cards played on it. It's not great but better than useless, definitely not a rare relic though, would deserve to be in shop.
I do think this is around the same strength as <olexa's shield> aka extremely situational at best but in the optimal situation it is average at best.

embeds.title: Olexa's Shield
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Swap the positions of the Bolstering Ghostflame and the first Searing Ghostflame.
*Protection on-demand.*

messages.content: these 2 relics gotta be touched in the hexa update
<mark of the ether> needs a change.

embeds.title: Mark of the Ether
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Replaces Spirit Brand.
The first time you Ignite a Ghostflame each turn, gain :energy_hexa: .
*Let’s see if we can do... better.*

messages.content: would it work as every time you ignite a ghostflame gain block
I don't think it is anywhere near as bad as soul of chaos or olexa's shield
mark of the ether just fails at the job it tries to do both as a starter upgrade and as a hovering kite clone
uhhhhh well.... That already exists as a relic?
as a hovering kite clone, it's too easy to proc, as a starter upgrade, it's like ring of the serpent because you have subzero max hp and spirit brand is really really really important
I think of Mark of Ether similarly to [[writ of mandamus]]. You trade around the same amount of block for energy.

embeds.title: Writ of Mandamus
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Reliquary

Gain :colorless_energy: at the start of your turn. At the end of your turn, you lose 5 **Block** :p_block:.
*It begins, "Whatever you're thinking about doing: hold it, mister."*

messages.content: if you use the extra energy on a defend, that's only one more block than spirit brand
I mean, that relic looks awful.
Unless you have something insane going on.
just have thread and needle
like a block plan?
you lose the thread and needle by taking mark of the ether lol
that is insane yes
my block plan is my hp pool
I mean, you're taking five more damage on a lot of turns.
*-* Mad Gremlin, 2024
You're basically expected to take chip damage in this game.
and this increases that chip by five.
It's basically philo stone but instead of being bad into multihits its bad into everything.

its an alternative to philo stone:
-better if you are being attacked 6 or more times
-equal if you are being attacked 5 times
-worse if you are being attacked 4 or less times
:thumbeline:
most enemies attack once or twice.
yes im joking
there's like, three enemies in the game that attack more than twice I think.
multi enemy combats
birds, stabby book, heart
glad to hear you have erased snake plant from your memory
there's also guardian but that's act 1 and that means you boss swapped
snake plant :dead:
also
kid named the maw
and writhing mass
okay but maw attacks for like 5 damage
so just like kill it
its 10 damage now bozo
okay maw after eight million turns
heart might be the pascal's mugging that makes writ overall better than philo
even though taking writ makes me feel bad
writ is takeable if you have a lot of passive block
Mark of the Ether is good with passive block
Soul of Chaos.... move it to shop, please.
I agree and just scrap olexa's shield. It's a bolster rod clone that messes up the gf wheel.
olexas shield is a little bit better now especially late because of poltergeist+ literally being the entire ironclad exhaust archetype
Are we talking about official hexaghost or the weird reworked one
currently regular one
Turn all your ghostflames into mayhem ghost flames :^)

this relic takes a lot of work to use and its probably not worth it most of the time. You sort of need to use <here and now> with this to make an acutal strategy out of the free mayhem effect; but its awkward to set up here and now at the same time as this since the ghostflame will self activate. You can use retract or advanced to force the combo, but those cards become dead cards in your deck after you set up your mayhem ghostflame since you never want to move off of it.

embeds.title: Here and Now
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 (0) :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

You no longer Advance at the end of turn.
At the start of your turn, gain :energy_hexa: .

messages.content: plus this relic does not benefit from your intensity at all. In general it heavily limits your card options since a lot of hexaghosts kit is not built to work with this.

if you ignore soul of chaos it even has the potential to sabotage you by preventing you from speeding through ghostflames or taking away potential damage from your scaling; it can even hit haunted hand and get rid of your cards! Making this relic a skip a concerning amount of the time.

~~dumb idea:~~
~~make it benefit from intensity~~
